frame.name: Accoutrements
frame.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Wearer</fen> wears accessories, which are made of some <fen>Material</fen> and may have a <fen>Style</fen>. Most of the accessories are non-essential (clothing) items. <ex><fex name="Wearer">She</fex> wore <fex name="Descriptor">a black</fex> <fex name="Material">velvet</fex> <t>hat</t> <fex name="Body_location">on her head</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Wearer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Wearer</fen> wears the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>. <ex>Why must you always wear <fex name="Wearer">your</fex> <t>helmet</t> when I'm driving?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Style
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Style</fen> of the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>. <ex>He wore <fex name="Style">a Jacobean</fex> <t>wig</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Material
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Material</fen> from which the <fen>Accoutrement</fen> is made.<ex>He wore a <fex name="Material">gold</fex> <t>watch</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Accoutrement
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>. <ex>She wore a <fex name="Acout">tiara</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Descriptor
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a characteristic or description of the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>. <ex>Kim wore <fex name="Desc">an exquisite</fex> <t>tiara</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Use
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Accoutrement</fen> is worn or made.
<ex>She was wearing <fex name="Use">reading</fex> <t>glasses</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Part
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies a part of the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>. <ex>He bought a leather <t>cap</t> <fex name="Part">with sheepskin flaps</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body_location
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the place on the body where a particular <fen>Accoutrement</fen> is located. <ex>Tess wore a single <t>ring</t> <fex name="Body_loc">in her left nostril</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Creator
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual or group who created the <fen>Accoutrement</fen>.
<ex>We found this <fex name="cre">Chinese</fex> <t>anklet</t> two layers below Tel-Wilaya 3.</ex> <ex><fex name="cre">De Beers</fex> <t>jewelry</t> is justly famous.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Time_of_creation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Accoutrement</fen> was created.
<ex>What was a <fex name="tim">17th century</fex> <t>brooch</t> doing in her attic?</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Name
FE.definition:
<def-root>A name given to an individual <fen>Accoutrement</fen> to distinguish it from all other objects.
<ex>The <t>ring</t> <fex name="nam">Narya</fex> was passed to Gandalf.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: regalia.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: the insignia of royalty, especially the crown and other ornaments used at a coronation.

lexUnit.name: anklet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornament worn round an ankle.

lexUnit.name: ring.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small circular band, typically of precious metal, worn on a finger as an ornament or as a token of marriage or engagement. [Jewellery]

lexUnit.name: earring.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of jewellery worn on the lobe or edge of the ear.

lexUnit.name: jewellery.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: mass noun personal ornaments, such as necklaces, rings, or bracelets, that are made from or contain jewels and precious metal.

lexUnit.name: necklace.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornamental chain or string of beads, jewels, or links worn round the neck.

lexUnit.name: bangle.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a rigid ornamental band worn around the arm.

lexUnit.name: bracelet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornamental band or chain worn on the wrist or arm. [Jewellery]

lexUnit.name: coronet.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a small crown, sometimes of flowers, used for decorating the head

lexUnit.name: crown.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a circular ornamental headdress worn by a monarch as a symbol of authority.

lexUnit.name: brooch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornament fastened to clothing with a hinged pin and catch.

lexUnit.name: tiara.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a.a jewelled ornamental band worn on the front of a woman's hair

lexUnit.name: circlet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornamental circular band worn on the head.

lexUnit.name: diadem.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a jewelled crown or headband worn as a symbol of sovereignty.

lexUnit.name: chain.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a connected flexible series of metal links used for fastening, pulling, etc., or in jewellery.

lexUnit.name: locket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small ornamental case worn round a person's neck on a chain and used to hold things of sentimental value.

lexUnit.name: pendant.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of jewellery that hangs from a necklace chain.

lexUnit.name: wig.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for the head made of real or artificial hair.

lexUnit.name: toupee.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small wig or artificial hairpiece worn to cover a bald spot.

lexUnit.name: cufflink.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device for fastening together the sides of a shirt cuff, passed through a hole in each side of the cuff.

lexUnit.name: glasses.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a pair of lenses set in a frame that rests on the nose and ears, used to correct or assist defective eyesight.

lexUnit.name: spectacles.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: Brit. a pair of glasses.

lexUnit.name: hat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a shaped covering for the head, typically with a brim and a crown.

lexUnit.name: hat-pin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long pin used to hold a woman's hat in position. (listed as hatpin)

lexUnit.name: cap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a soft, flat hat without a brim and usually with a peak.

lexUnit.name: bonnet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a woman's or child's hat tied under the chin and with a brim framing the face.

lexUnit.name: mask.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a covering for all or part of the face, worn as a disguise, for protection or hygiene, or for theatrical effect.

lexUnit.name: bandanna.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a large coloured handkerchief or neckerchief.

lexUnit.name: headband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a band of fabric worn around the head as a decoration or to keep the hair of

lexUnit.name: hairpiece.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a patch or bunch of false hair used to augment a person's natural hair.

lexUnit.name: fez.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. fezzes a flat-topped conical red hat with a black tassel on top, worn by men in some Muslim countries.

lexUnit.name: skullcap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small close-fitting peakless cap or protective helmet.

lexUnit.name: top-hat.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man's formal hat with a high cylindrical crown. (listed as top hat)

lexUnit.name: accoutrement.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an additional item of dress or equipment.

lexUnit.name: yarmulkah.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a skullcap worn in public by Orthodox Jewish men or during prayer by other Jewish men. (listed as yarmulke)

lexUnit.name: balaclava.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a close-fitting woollen hat covering the whole head and encircling the neck.

lexUnit.name: beret.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a round flattish cap of felt or cloth.

lexUnit.name: biretta.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a square cap with three flat projections on top, worn by Roman Catholic clergymen.

lexUnit.name: boater.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a flat-topped hardened straw hat with a brim. orig. worn while boating.

lexUnit.name: bowler.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man's hard felt hat with a round dome-shaped crown.

lexUnit.name: nightcap.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: historical a cap worn in bed.

lexUnit.name: panama.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man's wide-brimmed hat of straw-like material, originally made from the leaves of a tropical palm tree.

lexUnit.name: sombrero.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: .pl. -os a broad-brimmed felt or straw hat, typically worn in Mexico and the south-western US.

lexUnit.name: trilby.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: pl. -ies chiefly Brit. a soft felt hat with a narrow brim and indented crown.

lexUnit.name: turban.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a man's headdress, consisting of a long length of material wound round a cap or the head, worn especially by Muslims and Sikhs.

lexUnit.name: shako.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a cylindrical or conical military hat with a peak and a plume or pompom.

lexUnit.name: veil.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of fine material worn to protect or conceal the face

lexUnit.name: headdress.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornamental covering for the head, especially one worn on ceremonial occasions.

lexUnit.name: headpiece.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a device worn on the head.

lexUnit.name: belt.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a strip of leather or other material worn around the waist to support or hold in clothes or to carry weapons.

lexUnit.name: trinket.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small ornament or item of jewellery that is of little value.

lexUnit.name: choker.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a close-fitting necklace or ornamental neckband.

lexUnit.name: sporran.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small pouch worn around the waist so as to hang in front of the kilt as part of men's Scottish Highland dress.

lexUnit.name: snood.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an ornamental hairnet or pouch worn over the hair at the back of a woman's head.

lexUnit.name: hairnet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a fine mesh for confining the hair.

lexUnit.name: hairslide.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: Brit. a clip for keeping a woman's hair in position.

lexUnit.name: hairpin.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a U-shaped pin for fastening the hair.

lexUnit.name: hairband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a band for securing or tying back one's hair.

lexUnit.name: hairgrip.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: Brit. a flat hairpin with the ends close together.

lexUnit.name: sash.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long strip or loop of cloth worn over one shoulder or round the waist.

lexUnit.name: watch.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small timepiece worn typically on a strap on one's wrist.

lexUnit.name: medal.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a metal disc with an inscription or design, awarded to acknowledge distinctive achievement or made to commemorate an event.

lexUnit.name: medallion.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a piece of jewellery in the shape of a medal, worn as a pendant.

lexUnit.name: ribbon.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a long, narrow strip of fabric, used for tying something or for decoration.

lexUnit.name: badge.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a small piece of metal, plastic, or cloth bearing a design or words, typically worn to identify a person or to indicate support for a cause.

lexUnit.name: armband.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a band worn around the upper arm to hold up a shirtsleeve or as a form of identification.

lexUnit.name: armlet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a bracelet worn round the upper arm.

lexUnit.name: goggles.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: close-fitting protective glasses with side shields.

lexUnit.name: mitre.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a tall headdress worn by bishops and senior abbots, tapering to a point at front and back with a deep cleft between. [Eccl]

lexUnit.name: helm.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a helmet.

lexUnit.name: helmet.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a hard or padded protective hat.

lexUnit.name: gorget.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: an article of clothing or piece of armour covering the throat

lexUnit.name: greaves.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: historical a piece of armour for the shin. [MilHist] (listed as greave)

lexUnit.name: coif.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a close-fitting cap, currently made of cloth, but formerly made of metal and worn under armour for protection

lexUnit.name: hauberk.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: historical a full-length coat of mail.

lexUnit.name: mantle.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a loose sleeveless cloak or shawl.

lexUnit.name: gas mask.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a protective mask used to cover the face as a defence against poison gas.
